subject: Q1 2026 Roadmap Review
body:
Hi team,

I've put together the Q1 2026 roadmap draft based on our December planning sessions. Key highlights include:

1. Launch the new Analytics Dashboard (Project Aurora)
2. API v3 rollout with GraphQL support
3. Enterprise SSO improvements

Please review the attached deck and share feedback before our Thursday sync.

Best,
Priya

subject: Re: Q1 2026 Roadmap Review
body:
Priya,

Looks solid. A couple of thoughts:

- The GraphQL migration timeline seems aggressive. Emily and David estimate 6 weeks minimum for the schema design alone. Can we discuss phasing?
- We need to factor in the infrastructure upgrades Ana is planning for late January.

Let's dig into this Thursday.

Marcus

subject: Re: Q1 2026 Roadmap Review
body:
Both great points. Priya, let's also make sure we have clear success metrics for each initiative. James, can you bring customer feedback data from the enterprise accounts to the Thursday meeting?

Sarah

subject: Infrastructure Upgrade Plan - K8s Migration
body:
Hi Marcus,

I've completed the assessment for migrating our staging environment to the new AKS cluster. Summary:

- Estimated downtime: 2 hours during off-peak
- Cost savings: ~18% on compute after migration
- Timeline: Jan 20-24 for staging, Feb 3-7 for production

I've documented the full plan in the shared engineering folder. David is helping with the database migration scripts.

Let me know if you'd like to walk through it before I present to the team.

Ana

subject: Contoso Enterprise Deal - Update
body:
James,

Great news on the Contoso account. After last week's demo, they're moving forward with a 200-seat enterprise license. They want:

1. Custom SSO integration (SAML + OIDC)
2. Dedicated support SLA
3. On-prem data residency option

Total deal value: $340K ARR. I've updated the pipeline in Salesforce. Can we loop in Marcus for the SSO technical scoping?

Ryan

subject: Re: Contoso Enterprise Deal - Update
body:
Excellent work Ryan! This is our biggest enterprise deal this quarter.

Sarah - FYI on this win. Marcus - can your team scope the SSO and data residency requirements? I want to get back to Contoso by end of next week.

James

subject: Analytics Dashboard Mockups Ready
body:
Hi Liam & Priya,

The first round of mockups for Project Aurora is ready for review. I've created three layout options based on the user research sessions we ran in December.

Key design decisions:
- Dark mode default with light mode toggle
- Drag-and-drop widget customization
- Real-time data refresh indicators

The Figma file is linked in the shared project folder. Emily, I'd love your input on the component architecture feasibility.

Mia

subject: Blog Post Draft: 2025 Year in Review
body:
Hi James & Sarah,

I've drafted our 2025 Year in Review blog post highlighting key milestones:

- 3x customer growth
- API v2 launch
- SOC 2 Type II certification
- Partnership with Fabrikam

Please review and let me know if there's anything to add or adjust in tone. I'd like to publish by Jan 15th.

Olivia

subject: Security Audit Findings - Action Required
body:
Marcus & Ana,

Our quarterly security scan flagged a few items that need attention:

1. Three npm packages with known CVEs in the frontend build (medium severity)
2. TLS 1.0 still enabled on the legacy API gateway
3. Two service accounts with overly broad permissions in Azure AD

I've documented details and remediation steps in the attached report. Items 1 and 2 should be addressed within 14 days per our security policy.

Noah

subject: Sprint 24 Retrospective Notes
body:
Team,

Thanks for a productive retro today. Here's the summary:

What went well:
- Aurora frontend prototype delivered ahead of schedule
- Great cross-team collaboration between Emily and Mia on the component library

What to improve:
- PR review turnaround time (target: < 24 hours)
- Better estimation on backend tasks

Action items:
- David to set up automated PR reminder bot
- Ana to document the new deployment checklist
- Emily to create shared component storybook

Notes are in the shared Sprint folder.

Liam

subject: Fabrikam Partnership - Joint Webinar Planning
body:
Olivia & Priya,

Fabrikam wants to co-host a webinar showcasing our integration. Proposed date: Feb 12th.

Olivia - can you handle the marketing logistics and landing page?
Priya - we'll need a product demo segment, maybe 15 minutes showing the API integration.

Let's discuss at our next marketing sync.

James

subject: Python SDK Beta Feedback
body:
Marcus & Liam,

I've compiled early feedback from the Python SDK beta testers (12 participants so far):

- 9/12 rated the DX as 'excellent' or 'good'
- Top request: async support for batch operations
- Bug reports: 3 issues filed, all related to auth token refresh
- Performance: 40% faster than the REST wrapper approach

Full report attached. I think we're on track for GA in February if we address the auth issues.

David
